    • Method Detail

      • settings

        public void settings()
        Initialise the setting of the window size.
        Overrides:
        settings in class processing.core.PApplet

      • setup

        public void setup()
        Initialize the game by loading resources such as images and setting up game elements, including the player, enemies, and map elements. This method resets the game state and loads various resources at the beginning of the game.
        Overrides:
        setup in class processing.core.PApplet

      • keyPressed

        public void keyPressed()
        Handles key press events, triggering specific actions based on the pressed keys and the current game state. This method responds to key presses and performs actions such as changing game speed, pausing the game, building towers, upgrading towers, and restarting the game when appropriate.
        Overrides:
        keyPressed in class processing.core.PApplet

      • keyReleased

        public void keyReleased()
        Receive key released signal from the keyboard.
        Overrides:
        keyReleased in class processing.core.PApplet

      • mousePressed

        public void mousePressed(processing.event.MouseEvent e)
        Handles mouse click events, performing various actions based on the game's state and user interactions. This method responds to mouse clicks and triggers actions, including building towers, selecting game buttons, upgrading tower properties, and adjusting the game speed.
        Overrides:
        mousePressed in class processing.core.PApplet
        Parameters:
        e - The MouseEvent object representing the mouse click event.

      • mouseReleased

        public void mouseReleased(processing.event.MouseEvent e)
        Overrides:
        mouseReleased in class processing.core.PApplet

      • checkGameState

        public void checkGameState()
        Checks the current game state, determining whether the player has won or lost the game. If the player's current mana is less than 0 then the GameState is set to Game Over. Else if all waves have been completed and the all enemies killed than the game is won.

      • gainManaPerSecond

        public void gainManaPerSecond()
        Increases the player's current mana over time, based on manaGainedPerSecond and game speed. It ensures that mana does not exceed the mana cap when it is gained through manaGainedPerSecond.

      • drawCostIndicator

        public void drawCostIndicator(float buttonX,
                              float buttonY,
                              float cost)
        Draws a cost indicator next to a game button to display the associated cost. The cost is rendered as a white background with black text, providing a visual representation of the resource cost required for the associated game action.
        Parameters:
        buttonX - The button's X-coordinate on the screen.
        buttonY - The button's Y-coordinate on the screen.
        cost - The action's mana cost, displayed next to the button.

      • moveWaveForwards

        public void moveWaveForwards()
        Progresses the current wave forward by reducing the current wave's prewavepause and then duration. Also manages enemy spawning

      • draw

        public void draw()
        Draw all elements in the game by current frame. updates the game state, draws various game elements, including the Gamemap, towers, enemies, buttons, mana bar, timer, and Gameover/Gamewin text on the screen.
        Overrides:
        draw in class processing.core.PApplet

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)

      • rotateImageByDegrees

        public processing.core.PImage rotateImageByDegrees(processing.core.PImage pimg,
                                                   double angle)
        Source: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/37758061/rotate-a-buffered-image-in-java
        Parameters:
        pimg - The image to be rotated
        angle - between 0 and 360 degrees
        Returns:
        the new rotated image

      • findPath

        public java.util.List<Tile> findPath(Tile[][] grid,
                                     int startRow,
                                     int startCol,
                                     int homeRow,
                                     int homeCol)
        Finds a path between two points on a grid using Depth-First Search (DFS).
        Parameters:
        grid - The 2D grid of tiles representing the environment.
        startRow - The row index of the starting tile.
        startCol - The column index of the starting tile.
        homeRow - The row index of the destination tile.
        homeCol - The column index of the destination tile.
        Returns:
        A list of tiles representing the path from the starting tile to the destination tile if a path exists, or null if no path is found.
